summary: All four requirements are substantially implemented. REQ-1 adds getAllSignUps in backend/main.mo. REQ-2 adds useGetAllSignUps in useQueries.ts. REQ-3 creates OwnerDashboard.tsx with auth gating, table, loading states, empty state, and navy/gold styling. REQ-4 adds a /owner route in App.tsx and a subtle footer link in Layout.tsx. One concern: the backend getAllSignUps requires admin permission via AccessControl rather than being a simple public query. Additionally, useActor.ts was modified despite being listed as a protected file in constraints.

hallucinated_features.description: A new utility file frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts was added with URL parameter parsing, sessionStorage persistence, and hash-based routing utilities including admin token handling (getSecretParameter, caffeineAdminToken). This was not requested in any requirement.
hallucinated_features.reason: No requirement mentions URL parameter utilities, session storage helpers, or caffeineAdminToken handling. This appears to be infrastructure for a separate admin token mechanism not part of the spec.

hallucinated_features.description: The backend getAllSignUps function enforces admin-only access control via AccessControl.hasPermission, and useActor.ts calls _initializeAccessControlWithSecret with a caffeineAdminToken. This layered access control system was not requested.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-1 specifies a public query function returning all sign-ups. The spec non-goals explicitly exclude role-based access control. The caffeineAdminToken mechanism is not part of any requirement.

hallucinated_features.description: frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts was modified despite being listed as a protected file that must not be modified.
hallucinated_features.reason: The constraint explicitly states do not modify frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts. The diff shows useActor.ts was modified to add getSecretParameter import and _initializeAccessControlWithSecret call.
